A pretty fun, if simple, wave-based Zombie Horde shooter. The shooting mechanics are solid and are actually surprisingly fun, as the game has no crosshairs, so it's ever so slightly more satisfying to nail a hip-fire headshot. You earn money each wave, and using that money you can buy better weapons and body armour. I acquired this game during a sale for £3.74, so I'd say it definitely feels like it's worth more than what I paid.

Suffice to say, this game has got a lot of potential. Another good alternative to other zombie shooters or to someone who loves those kinds of games. My evaluation is no different than the other reviews posted here. However, the real reason why I would say it is a waste of money is that there will always be issues to host a game. 

The thing is, I tried to set up a multiplayer match in killing floor mode. I tried this out with my friend from Steam. We both were thinking what to try and finally decided on this game in hopes to play it co-operatively. 

The first impression I got was mixed already. The design is great and suitable to play on those nights or on Halloween. When I tried to host the match, I would get 2 messages of caution. They were about enabling the ports or plug and play function, or allowing the game as an exception for the firewall. Everything looked fine until I set up the multiplayer match. 

My friend and I live far apart, so our method of co-op play would be something like Internet play, not LAN. I do not know if there would be issues if we were playing at a closer distance using LAN, but the real problem is Internet play when trying to play with your friend.

My friend could not see my hosted game, even when he tried to join my game via Steam Friend list. Even invitations would not work. The firewall has got an exception on this game, so the issue is not with it. Other methods like tampering with functions inside killing floor.ini file, would make it even worse, leaving a message like this "You must have a connection or Steam enabled to play this game" (or something like this, since I've written this from my memory).

My suggestion is not to buy this game. Instead of wasting time and trying to figure out the intrinsic issues, it is better to find a game, that actually proves to be compatible with Steam Friend list, a game like Left 4 Dead where you can easilly join your friend in a co-op match. Old issues about ports have been solved in such games.

Killing Floor has put itself up there with the major competitors on my list of favourite Zombie games which is saying something since my taste is that of a man who loves gore and blowing off zombies heads! Killing Floor has truly made me hungry for more though, with it's hilariously made rounds and maps off the workshop which are mostly made amazingly with a couple of bugs but it can be said that they are incredibly fun to play, it's massive selection of weapons and skins make it a game worth buying! It also takes very little to run in it I find which is down to how old it is but still to this day this could be one of the best Zombie games I have ever played. However this game may not make the top spot on my list for now it will be at third place! Anyone who cannot run massive Zombie games should buy this! The DLC is quite pointless but looks great and adds in some weapons you are going to want! 

I give this game an 8.9/10!

FPS co-op zombie wave defense.
Highly recommend this game, though there is a lot of grinding to level up. I recommend levelling up the sharpshooter class first, as it only needs headshots, not damage done to get to level six.

I feel at this point in time that there is little I need say of Killing Floor that hasn’t already been voiced by so many other avid Steam gamers, so I’ll keep it brief.

The gameplay is truly addictive, and despite some gripes people have over a limited weapon selection (which isn’t all that ‘limited’ in my opinion) there are plenty of DLC character/weapon packs to purchase (as well as some unlockable ones too).  The game looks great on the highest settings, even by today’s standards, the sound design is good, and there are over 200 achievements to unlock if that’s your thing, including special Halloween/Christmas ones.  It also utilizes a ‘Perk’ system that can be leveled in RPG-like fashion, each perk having a unique weapon class load out that can truly make/break you depending on your perk level and the game’s more challenging difficulty settings. And let’s not forget the soon to be released Killing Floor 2, which looks absolutely insane!

For now though, there is still plenty of glorious carnage to partake of in Killing Floor, so until Killing Floor 2 is unleashed upon us, have at it!!
You'd think this game would get boring after a while, but it doesn't, it stays fun and entertaining because no match feels the same.

MAC USERS BEWARE!!!!!!!!!!! Apparently there is a glitch tha prevents Mac users from leveling up. I have spent the past three hours playing, racking up hundreds of kills, and absolutely 0 of them ended up counting at the end of the match towards leveling up. Yes, I was completing the proper task requried for leveling up on the proper type of server. I was checking my stats as the match went on to make sure it was counting, and it was. Once the match was complete, I checked again and it was back to what i started at. Having a game based around a leveling system that doesn't work is pointless. Spend your money elsewhere, where the developer actually cares about the user. This glitch has been going on SINCE 2012!!!

One of the funniest FPS co-op games out there! 
You and up to 6 friends, battle it out to clear the UK of Cloned Monsters.
The game is a "Wave" based game, as you try to survive  creatures like the Clots, Strikers, Crawler, Gorefast, Bloat, Husk, Siren, Scrake and Fleshpound.  At the last wave you get a boss battle with Patriarch who can be challenging to defeat on 'Normal' difficulty! 
Killing Floor is best with friends as you learn to work as a team, covering and healing your friends to stay alive. The sad thing about this game is that there is no story mode and a ton of DLC!  But overall it’s a great co-op game and always making you come back for more.  9/10battle it out to clear the UK of cloned monsters (And Zombies on Halloween) The game is a "Wave" based game, as you try to survive  creatures like the Clots, Strikers, Crawler, Gorefast, Bloat, Husk, Siren, Scrake and Fleshpound. At the last wave you get a boss battle with Patriarch who can be a challenging to defeat on Normal difficulty! Killing Floor is best with friends as you learn to work as a team, healing and covering your friends to stay alive. The sad thing about this game is that there is no story mode and a ton of DLC! But overall it’s a great co-op game and always making you come back for more. 9/10

Killing Floor es realmente un juego muy entretenido para jugar con amigos. Tanto por su dinámica como por la cantidad de escenarios que tiene, todos con sus particularidades. Realmente engancha. Sin embargo, no le recomiendo este juego a nadie, ya que, como a mí (y a la gran mayoría de los amigos con los que suelo jugar, o intentar jugar) da muchísimos problemas a la hora de alojar partidas para jugar online. He mirado en infinidad de foros, he abierto puertos del router (lo cual, para personas con ningún conocimiento de informática es bastante engorroso), he hecho lo indecible. Y sigo sin poder jugar. Y nadie parece encontrar una solución a este problema. 

Creo que he perdido mi dinero comprando este juego, y es una lástima. Si hubiese sabido que no iba a poder jugar con mis amigos, no lo hubiese comprado nunca.

Killing Floor is a  wave defense, undead monster shoot-em up. Altough the game can be enjoyable at times (best with a multitude of friends or strangers; solo play is absolutely terrible), this game unfortunately falls into the category of "hard." Here, the game feels artificially "hard", with combating most baddies not really based on any kind of skill. Notable enemeies include the chainsaw weilding "Scrake", the hulk-like "Fleshpound", and the enemy boss "Patriarch" at the end of the mission. These enemies just feel cheap, with the boss also falling into the category of "bullet sponge." In general, these enemies fuck your shit up simply because there's no way of getting away from them (no cover, no sprint, no dodge; just your granny shuffle, a gun, and hopefully a fireteam backing you up). All of these enemies rush their intended target, so unless you can hop a fence to stay away from them, they are guaranteed to be in your face and will kill you unless you can beat them in the damage output race that will ensue (spoiler alert: you lose in most cases).

Another bone to pick is with enemy spawning. Either I'm just very unlucky, or the game prefers spawning enemies behind you. You can run through a previously cleared room, and upon reaching the other side, turn around to see a shitload of enemies right on your ass ready to gnaw it off. You can even get enemies to spawn on your ass by just turning around while near a door to a room. For the love of satan, don't backpedal down a hallway with no-one checking your six, you'll just run into a metric fuck-ton of monsters. :p

Pros:
1) Fun co-op play with friends or strangers with a heavy need for teamwork
2) A multitude of weapons with varying characteristics (recoil, damage)
3) Varied enemies, with each bringing different dynamics to firefights

Cons:
1) Painfully slow movement
2) Bullet sponge bosses
3) Annoying enemy spawning
4) Mostly* useless melee attack (*mostly; the main benefit being that you move faster with the knife out)
Fun with friends, but really hard solo!

Достоинства: 
Нет игрового прицела, сложная в прохождении, можно играть с друзьями.
Недостатки: 
Придется купить если хотите нормально поиграть.
Внимание! Внимание! Внимание! Группа зачистки приступает к действию.
Killing Floor - шутер от первого лица, целью которого является сурвайвл, то бишь убить всех зомби и выжить самому (или с командой, смотря какие цели вы преследуете). 

Игру можно приобрести в стиме, если вы хотите официально играть в мультиплеер с друзьями, безо всяких проблем настроить и запустить собственный сервер да и вообще, раз в жизни купить игру, оно того стоит. Нет никаких проблем с игрой, захотел - зашел, захотел - вышел, никаких обязательств играть или сидеть до конца нет и это плюс. В игре множество разнообразного оружия и видов персонажа, но все это за дополнительные денежки - это минус (хотя никто вас не заставляет покупать эти дополнения). Сам геймплей интересен, в игре нет прицела как такового, только настоящий целик-мушка, либо коллиматорный прицел. Накопить на оружие достаточно сложно, нужно хорошо отстреливать зомби и меньше умирать, так же можно попросить денег у товарищей. Интересно играть с друзьями, но проблемно если игра куплена не в системе стим, даже не знаю как можно аналогово играть в мультиплеер, кроме как купив оригинал игры.
В общем идея - супер, реализация - хорошо, удовольствие - хорошо, денежки - плохо, однако, рекомендую!
